event.name: BLACKMARKET_CRYSTAL_KNICKNACKS
event.text: A Crystalline market is established here, a rare sight. It appears to have drawn a large crowd, and is selling Crystal relics.

event.name: BLACKMARKET_DESPERATE_SLUG
event.text: A Slug ship, painted in pirate colors, appears to be trying to make a trade between the different ships at this beacon, but to no avail.

The Slug captain appears surprised that you reached out to him. He quickly regains his composure. "Greetingsss! This is a mosst fortuitousss day for you. I jusssst ssso happen to be ssselling a rare and powerful weapon, would you be interesssted?"
You hand over the scrap to him, wary of any tricks he might pull. Instead, he deposits a cargo box and quickly jumps away.
You carefully pry open the box and look inside. To your dismay, the "rare and powerful" weapon you just purchased was nothing more than a defense laser.
"Fine, fine. What if I lower the price?""
You hand over the scrap to him, wary of any tricks he might pull. Instead, he deposits a cargo box and quickly jumps away.
You carefully pry open the box and look inside. To your dismay, the "rare and powerful" weapon you just purchased was nothing more than a defense laser.
"You don't know what you're missssing out on. What if I lower the price even more?"
You hand over the scrap to him, wary of any tricks he might pull. Instead, he deposits a cargo box and quickly jumps away.
You carefully pry open the box and look inside. To your dismay, the "rare and powerful" weapon you just purchased was nothing more than a defense laser.
"Urgh, you're really twisssting my leg here. Final price, take it or leave it."
You hand over the scrap to him, wary of any tricks he might pull. Instead, he deposits a cargo box and quickly jumps away.
You carefully pry open the box and look inside. To your dismay, the "rare and powerful" weapon you just purchased was nothing more than a defense laser.
"Ok ok, that wasss a lie. Thisss isss my final offer. Take your time, think it over."
You hand over the scrap to him, wary of any tricks he might pull. Instead, he deposits a cargo box and quickly jumps away.
You carefully pry open the box and look inside. To your dismay, the "rare and powerful" weapon you just purchased was nothing more than a defense laser.
"Aggghh, pleassse! Just buy it!"
You hand over the scrap to him, wary of any tricks he might pull. Instead, he deposits a cargo box and quickly jumps away.
You carefully pry open the box and look inside. To your dismay, the "rare and powerful" weapon you just purchased was nothing more than a defense laser.
"Fine! Jusssst take it! Free of charge! I don't care anymore!"
You agree to take it for free. He angrily jettisons a defense laser out into space and jumps away.
The Slug screams in pure rage and ends the call. Next thing you know, his weapons are up and you should do the same!
You ignore the Slug and hide behind a nearby moon so he won't try to contact you next.

event.name: DESPERATE_SLUG_WIN
event.text: With the Slugs dead, you move in to inspect their cargo. You find a cache of cargo boxes, at least a hundred of them. You open them all, finding only Basic Lasers. Looks like they overstocked on these and didn't buy anything else...

event.name: BLACKMARKET_SHEEPISH_FED
event.text: You're surprised to see a Federation ship here, or at least one not marked in pirate paint.
A human captain answers your hail. Younger than typical, and he seems rather embarrassed. "So uh, you're with the Federation too? Hehe... this is a bit of an awkward spot to meet, isn't it?"

"Hah good, so you're a reasonable one. If my squadron leader saw me here... oh boy." He chuckles nervously, rubbing at his neck. "Say, you uh, you wouldn't happen to have any extra space on your ship, would you? Like, for new crew I mean."

His face brightens. "Really? Like, could I come along?" You nod and he jumps with joy. "I'll grab my things immediately." He comes aboard shortly after, bidding his crew goodbye. "You're really doing me a solid, had I stayed on my ship I would have been slammed for sure for being here."

"Oh, right. Should have figured, your mission is probably pretty important anyways." You nod. "Well uh, best be going then, gotta buy those supplies and get out of this sector before I'm caught. Glad to see a friendly face though." He waves goodbye and ends the call.
"Well hey now, let's not forget you're here as well. We uh, ran low on some supplies, and this seemed like a good spot as any to buy some."

"What?! Hey, who do you think you are?" You lie to them, saying you're here to enforce Federation law on the sector. "Really, enforcers now are you? My ass." Next thing you know their weapons are armed and you've found yourself in a brawl!
You grunt in disapproval and hang up. You try not to reflect on your hypocritical actions and watch in shame as the other Federation ship jumps away.
The ship slinks away from you and jumps away after a couple minutes, leaving you alone.

event.name: BLACKMARKET_VENGEFUL_ENGI
event.text: A Separatist Engi ship is already here, transferring goods between a slaver ship. Upon your arrival, the slavers beckon for them to speed up the process then jump away.
You hail the Engi ship. "Mission = vengeance. The Mantis raid Engi homelands, and take [Engi] as captives. The favor has been -returned-." It appears they are selling Mantis slaves.

choice.text: Ask to buy a Mantis slave.

event.text: The Engi are more than willing to sell a Mantis to you, and at a reasonable price as well. They offer a few choices.
You change your mind. Maybe buying a Mantis slave isn't a good idea after all. The Separatists Engi don't seem to mind.
The Engi aren't naturally vengeful, but these are Separatists after all. You don't risk pressing further.
No need to get involved in other people's business.

event.name: BLACKMARKET_SICK_MARKET
event.text: An inconspicuous station is posted here, probably an honest trader looking to make a profit somewhere with larger crowds.

choice.text: Contact them to see if they want to trade.

event.text: The station's leader appears on your vid-screen, coughing. "W-what? Oh, sorry. No trading for now, we're all sick. This damn place draws in thousands of ships from all over the galaxy, god knows what kinds of diseases it brings. We're probably dying of some exotic Mantis flu or something, if that even exists."

choice.text: Offer what supplies you can muster. [-10~, -2|]

event.text: "This won't help much, but it's much appreciated. Glad to know there's some kind souls out there still. I can't offer much in return, but we can use our automated repair drones to fix up some hull for you."

The captain isn't sure what that even means, but he lets you do it anyways. After some time the state of their entire crew is looking much better. "I don't know what kind of voodoo magic that was, but I feel great. It's only right if we offer some payment in return."

The station's crew is frightened at first that they're under attack, but soon realize your healing bursts are only improving their condition. "How peculiar, I've never seen medical supplies such as those. Would you be willing to sell them to us, in case this sort of situation ever occurs again?"
"Thank you, this will prove to be very useful. Let us repair some damage for you as well using our automated repair drones."
"Ah well, fair enough. Here, let us patch up your hull with our automated repair drones regardless as thanks."

choice.text: Take this chance to rob them!

event.text: "Really? Is there no good will left in this whole place?"
The captain thanks you and ends the call. Now you have some free time on your hands.
You have no desire to trade with the station.

event.name: SMUGGLER_WONDERDRONE
event.text: "Greetings! You look like a guy who benefit greatly from never seen before drone tech! That's right, we bring to you the brand new WONDERDRONE (tm). As you can see, this special drone comes equipped with 4 different weapons! Just give 'er a good smack when there's nothin' else to do and it'll change what weapon it fires. This is a steal of a deal kid, you'd have to be an idiot not to take it."
"Damn it, we got another angry one! Arm the weapons..."
"Aw, that's too bad." You cut comms and leave.
"Alright fine. How about this?"
"Aw, that's too bad." You cut comms and leave.
"You dare insult us? This is an excellent price for an outstanding drone!" The Smugglers raise their weapons, furious.

event.name: SMUGGLER_PLAYER_WEPS
event.text: A Black Market station is selling unique weapons and drones here which consume less power than normal.
There's nothing offered that you're interested in buying.

event.name: REFUGEE_PIRATE_MV
event.text: Your sensors have picked up a refugee ship drifting through the system, no doubt one of many fleeing the Rebel advance. It doesn't appear to have detected you... or else it is trying to avoid notice.
As you hail the refugee ship, a pirate ship jumps into the system... it was using the refugee ship as bait!
You power up your weapons and engage the pirate ship.
The fight brings them out of your immediate scanning range. After a time the distress calls stop.

textList.name: PIRATE_CIVILIAN
textList.text: You arrive in the system to see a pirate ship pursuing a civilian ship. You detect messages from the civilian ship on a distress frequency.
Scanners indicate that a battle is taking place nearby. It seems that someone is under attack by space pirates.
You detect two ships, one chasing the other... Scanners show the pursuer is a pirate!
There are only two ships within range and they seem to be engaged in battle. One of them has the markings of a space pirate.
You arrive at the next beacon only to be immediately hailed by a small shuttle. "Help us! We are being attacked by pirates!"
You come out of the jump to see laser blasts coming from the other side of the beacon. It looks like someone is under attack from pirates.

event.text: "Good choice, son. We've both come out of this richer."

choice.text: Try to be a hero. Attack the pirate.

event.text: The pirate ship stops its pursuit and locks weapons onto your ship.
Upon closer inspection, you realize the ship under attack was a Rebel scout! It's too damaged to put up much of a fight.

choice.text: Destroy the ship and salvage it.

event.text: You strip the ship of anything useful and leave its crew to hope help arrives.

choice.text: Use the leverage you gained by saving their lives to convince them to delay the pursuing fleet.

event.text: Hopefully that will buy you more time to get to the next sector.
You were too late. A hull breach deprived the crew of oxygen during your fight with the pirate. You salvage what you can.
The pirate's victim quickly jumps away before you have a chance to speak to them.
"Thank you for the aid! I'm an arms dealer that usually only works with Rebels, but considering the circumstances I'll make an exception."
"Thank the heavens you showed up! We don't have much to offer as a reward, but our Engineer should be proficient enough to patch your ship up a bit after that nasty fight."

textList.name: PIRATE_BRIBER
textList.text: You come across a pirate in hot pursuit of an unidentified ship. You quickly receive a transmission from the pirate: "Stay out of this fight and we'll make it worth your while."
An unidentified ship is badly damaged and still being assaulted by a space pirate. The victim begins a distress message until the pirate cuts in and offers to split the bounty if you sit tight.

A missile shoots across your bow when the jump completes. Your scans quickly reveal a ship with pirate markings pursuing an unknown vessel. The pirate hails you: "Damn it, we weren't expecting company. Stay out of this and you could profit."

event.name: PIRATE_NAME
event.text: You catch a conversation between a few pirates on the ship nearby. They're arguing over something, though it's hard to tell what.

"Yeah? Whaddya want?" You explain that you want to help resolve their problem. "You want to WHAT? That's pretty weird, but since you're offering... We just uh... legally obtained this new ship, and we can't think of a new name for it. Don't suppose you got any ideas?"

choice.text: Hold on, let us think of more ideas.

event.text: You think of a few more name ideas for the pirates.

choice.text: Give us another minute, we need to think more.

event.text: You think of a even more name ideas for the pirates.
You're beginning to run out of good ideas.

choice.text: Ok, we still need some time.

event.text: You're almost completely out of any ideas.

choice.text: Suggest the name 'Literally a Pirate Ship'.

event.text: The pirates have become very annoyed. "Oh for Newton's sake, just give us a damn name!"
You leave the pirates to their squabbling.

event.name: PIRATE_NAME_GREAT
event.text: The pirates have a brief discussion about your suggestion. "Perfect, this will be great! Thank you for your assistance, strange Federation ship. Here is some pay."
"That's an excellent name! Thank you for your assistance."
The pirates have a brief discussion about your suggestion. "Perfect, this will be great! Thank you for your assistance, strange Federation ship. Here is some pay."
"That's uh... well thanks for trying, but I'm not really sure that's what we're looking for."
"That's an excellent name! Thank you for your assistance."
The pirates have a brief discussion about your suggestion. "Perfect, this will be great! Thank you for your assistance, strange Federation ship. Here is some pay."
"Dear god, that is a horrible name. Please never speak to us again."
Somehow, the pirates seem to like your suggestion. They like it so much in fact that they pay you scrap so long as you promise never to insult them with your horrible suggestions ever again.

event.name: PIRATE_NAME_HORRIBLE
event.text: "Not only was that the worst name I have ever had the disgrace of hearing, but you have physically made my ears bleed just by listening to it. My second mate just went into cardiac arrest, and a fire almost started in our engines. It was so bad that I actually feel like vomiting right now. It was so tremendously horrible that I could feel a higher power literally die in disgrace that they created a creature as pathetic as you. I have no choice but to arm my weapons and obliterate you horrible mongrels, so that you cannot pollute and destroy this plane of reality any further."

event.name: SLAVER_DEAD_SLAVES
event.text: A slaver is advertising quality slaves for modest prices.

choice.text: Buy an unknown slave for 20 scrap.

event.text: "Ah yes, well about that. We uh... we can't show you... because... because they're all sleeping! Wouldn't want to wake them up."

choice.text: Seems legit. We'll buy one for 20 scrap.

event.text: "Alright alright! They're all dead, we're selling dead slaves, now let us go!" Unfortunately for them, you don't have any intentions of letting them off the hook.
The Slaver ship continues to advertise their "products", so you simply mute all hails coming from their ship.

choice.text: (Slug Crew) Have your Slug check their intentions.

event.text: "It sssseemsss thessse sssslaverss are ssselling dead ssslaves! Hah, what a racket. Gotta admire their gusssto. Ssstill, you ssshouldn't buy anything."
You prepare to attack the slaver ship, ready to make sure they don't scam anyone else.

choice.text: Follow your Slug's advice and leave.

event.text: The Slaver ship continues to advertise their "products", so you simply mute all hails coming from their ship.

choice.text: (Telepathic Shell) Have your Shell check their intentions.

event.text: "Thhhese slavers are selling dead bodies! You shhhouldn't hand over anythhhing to thhhem, othhher thhhan a well-earned lesson."
You prepare to attack the slaver ship, ready to make sure they don't scam anyone else.

choice.text: Follow your Shell's advice and leave.

event.text: The Slaver ship continues to advertise their "products", so you simply mute all hails coming from their ship.
The Slaver ship continues to advertise their "products", so you simply mute all hails coming from their ship.

event.name: SLAVER_DEAD_SLAVES_BUY
event.text: The Slavers thank you for your purchase and bring the slave onboard. However, it's clear something is wrong. The slave is a completely lifeless, motionless corpse.
You prepare to attack the slaver ship, furious that they tricked you.

choice.text: Demand they give your money back.

event.text: "Hey now, let's be real here. We never said anything about the slaves being ALIVE. It's all simply a misunderstanding. Best we can do is give you half the scrap back, out of fairness."

choice.text: We won't stand for this! Destroy them.

event.text: You prepare to attack the slaver ship, furious that they tricked you.

choice.text: (Upg. Weapons) Threaten them to give you all of your money back.

event.text: "Okay! Okay! Here, we'll even throw in some extra fuel because we're so kind!"

event.name: DEAD_CREW_SLAVER_DEADSLAVES
event.text: You find a number of slaves in the cargo hold. You could use more crew but it won't reflect positively on you for taking slaves like this.

choice.text: Demand the Mantis joins your crew but release the rest.

event.text: You pry open the cage containing the Mantis, only for them to fall dead on the ground. Oh, right...

choice.text: Demand the Rockman joins your crew but release the rest.

event.text: You pry open the cage containing the Rockman, only for them to fall dead on the ground. Oh, right...

choice.text: Demand the Engi joins your crew but release the rest.

event.text: You pry open the cage containing the Engi, only for them to fall dead on the ground. Oh, right...

choice.text: We aren't slavers. Free them all.

event.text: You open the cages, but none are eager to get out. That is when you remember that you were advertised dead slaves...

event.name: SLAVER_BETRAYAL
event.text: A slaver ship hails you directly, soliciting slaves for fair prices. "Only 35 scrap for a brand new worker! What a steal of a deal. You'd have to be an idiot not to take this offer while it still lasts."

choice.text: Buy an unknown slave for 35 scrap.

event.text: You prepare to attack the slaver.
"Ah, so we do got a couple of idiots over here!" The slaver hangs up and jumps away.

choice.text: (Slug Crew) Have your Slug check their intentions.
(Telepathic Shell) Have your Shell check their intentions.

event.text: The slavers bring over an unusually pristine slave, void of any restraints. As soon as the slavers return to their ship, the "slave" reveals a hidden blaster and turns on your crew! It was a trick!
The slavers bring out a prisoner in heavy shackles, and throw them aboard. The slaver captain hails you, and jumps away.

event.name: SLAVER_BETRAYAL_SLUG_BETRAY
event.text: Your crewmember tells you to be wary of the slaves. This whole thing is a scam.
You prepare to attack the treacherous slaver.
"Why suddenly so adverse to business? Oh well, maybe we'll find someone more eager to get the deal of a lifetime at the next beacon!"

event.name: SLAVER_BETRAYAL_SLUG_HUMAN
event.text: According to your crewmember, the slave being offered is a human.
You prepare to attack the treacherous slaver.
"Ah, so we do got a couple of idiots over here!" The slaver hangs up and jumps away.

event.name: SLAVER_BETRAYAL_SLUG_ENGI
event.text: According to your crewmember, the slave being offered is an Engi.
You prepare to attack the treacherous slaver.
"Ah, so we do got a couple of idiots over here!" The slaver hangs up and jumps away.

event.name: SLAVER_BETRAYAL_SLUG_ORCHID
event.text: According to your crewmember, the slave being offered is an Orchid.
You prepare to attack the treacherous slaver.
"Ah, so we do got a couple of idiots over here!" The slaver hangs up and jumps away.

event.name: SLAVER_BETRAYAL_SLUG_ROCK
event.text: According to your crewmember, the slave being offered is a Rockman.
You prepare to attack the treacherous slaver.
"Ah, so we do got a couple of idiots over here!" The slaver hangs up and jumps away.

event.name: SLAVER_BETRAYAL_SLUG_MANTIS
event.text: According to your crewmember, the slave being offered is a Mantis.
You prepare to attack the treacherous slaver.
"Ah, so we do got a couple of idiots over here!" The slaver hangs up and jumps away.

event.name: SLAVER_BETRAYAL_SLUG_CRYSTAL
event.text: According to your crewmember, the slave being offered is a Crystal.
You prepare to attack the treacherous slaver.
"Ah, so we do got a couple of idiots over here!" The slaver hangs up and jumps away.

event.name: SLAVER_LANIUS_SLAVE
event.text: You enter a beacon located in a very desolate system, used only as an intermediate waypoint to span the gap between more important systems for FTL travel. There is little here other than a lone civilian station above the beacon. Quite a while after arriving at the beacon, you are hailed by a black ship sporting black and red paint docked at the station.

The ship's captain coughs, then speaks, "We have obtained a miraculous metal man, capable of not only living without oxygen, but actively making the air unbreathable. However, our ship's Life Support system can't sustain its incredible qualities for more than a short span of time, so we're stuck here at this station in this miserable system. Agree to buy our metal man and we'll give you the deal of a lifetime."
The slaver is delighted to be freed of their liability and still earn a profit. They waste no time to transfer over the Lanius.

choice.text: Slavery is deplorable. Fight the slaver.

event.text: As you engage, the ship quickly undocks from the station and prepares to fight back.
You put some distance between you and the slaver. Once you're sure they won't bother you anymore, you consider doing something aboard the ship.

choice.text: (Mind Control) Convince them to donate the Lanius.

event.text: Your mind control system is able to easily convince the slaver captain that she should give you the Lanius for free so that they may depart for a more profitable beacon. The Lanius is quickly ejected towards your ship in a small shuttle before the effects of the mind control wear off. Realizing they've been tricked, the slaver separates from the station and powers up its weapons.

event.name: SLAVER_DRIFTER
event.text: A slaver ship is drifting nearby. You can tell just from looking at it that it's running on low to no power.

choice.text: You have no crew to send aboard the ship.

event.text: No need risking the ship or the mission over a ghost ship.
The ship remains completely unresponsive. You aren't sure if there's any life left on the ship.
Confident the former crew is dead, you start scrapping the outer hull. However, mid-way through the process the weapons mysteriously come online, and you can hear lethargic shuffling inside the ship.

To your surprise, your hail is answered almost immediately. Instead of comprehensible speech however, the response is garbled and mixed with static. Next thing you know, the ship's weapons come online and attacks you!

event.name: SLAVER_DRIFTER_CREW
event.text: Your crew reluctantly board the slaver ship. Your comms are stable for a while as they tell you what's happening, but suddenly, everything goes to static. After a few suspenseful minutes, the ship comes online and attacks!

removeCrew.text: You're surprised to see your crew member stumbling out of the Clone Bay. They tell you something about Ghosts, but you don't have much time to listen due to the impending assault.

event.name: SLAVER_DRIFTER_DRONE
event.text: Your drone navigates around the interior of the abandoned ship, though the image cuts out here and there. Suddenly, a shaky silhouette comes around a corner, and your drone's camera goes offline.
You try to pull in closer to recover the drone, but the ship comes online!

event.name: SLAVER_DRIFTER_DESTROYED
event.text: You may never know what happened to the original crew, but at least the Ghost ship will never bother anyone else. You scrap the hull.

event.name: SLAVER_DRIFTER_KILL
event.text: The Ghosts are gone, or at least you hope. You're reasonably comfortable scrapping the hull further, but not enough to stick around any longer than necessary.

event.name: BLACKMARKET_SUSPICIOUS_SMUGGLER
event.text: Though it has no conspicuous pirate markings, the ship at this beacon behaves very strangely. You suspect it's a smuggler, but without proof that claim has little bearing.
You prepare for combat.
You don't approach, but the ship seems aware that you noticed them. "Hey, uh, what are you looking at?"
"Y-yeah? And what about it?"
"O-oh. Yeah, of course. Come aboard!"
You prepare for combat.

event.name: BLACKMARKET_ENGI_ILLEGAL
event.text: To your surprise, a Zoltan ship is in the process of arresting an Engi ship. You aren't sure what the circumstances are, or if you should even get involved.

choice.text: Hail them an ask what's going on.

event.text: The Zoltan responds first, the Engi waiting patiently for them. "We are arresting these Engi for purchasing or willingly partaking in the sale of illegal goods or services."
"Impossible. Payment delivered as requested. Transaction completed successfully."
The Zoltan replies; "You have been caught purchasing illegal drugs from a Mantis vendor. This is a violation of both Federation, Zoltan, and Free-Space law."
"Negative. Goods purchased = production amplifiers. Nothing stolen, no illegal actions performed." The two ships continue arguing back and forth.

choice.text: Explain to the Engi that they purchased illegal drugs.
Aid the Zoltan in arresting the Engi.

event.text: You quickly explain to the Zoltan that you intend to help. "Fine, we will accept your assistance. But do not kill the Engi. This is a peaceful operation."
The Zoltan huff when you position your ship between them and the Engi. "You're aiding these criminals? Fine, then expect no mercy."

choice.text: (Engi Crew) Explain to the Engi that they purchased illegal drugs.

event.text: Your Engi is successfully able to explain the situation to the ship. You explain to the Zoltan the misunderstanding and the Engi transfer the drugs over to the Zoltans. Satisfied, the Zoltan ship jumps away. The Engi offer you some droneparts and a drone in thanks.
The Zoltan's business isn't your business, no need to get involved in their matters.
You try to explain to the Engi that the "production amplifiers" are drugs, but they don't understand. The Zoltan grows impatient.

choice.text: Aid the Zoltan in arresting the Engi.

event.text: You quickly explain the Zoltan that you intend to help. "Fine, we will accept your assistance. But do not kill the Engi. This is a peaceful operation."
The Zoltan huff when you position your ship between them and the Engi. "You're aiding these criminals? Fine, then expect no mercy."

At first you aren't sure if the Engi understand, but they slowly begin to realize. You explain to the Zoltan the misunderstanding and the Engi transfer the drugs over to the Zoltans. Satisfied, the Zoltan ship jumps away. The Engi offer you some droneparts in thanks.

event.name: BLACKMARKET_ENGI_ILLEGAL_SURRENDER
event.text: You notice the Engi's hull is getting low, and the Zoltan's warnings of not killing the Engi.

"Chances of success in combat... low. Surrender, necessary." The Engi power off their weapons and submit to the Zoltan ship. Once all of the Engi have been arrested, the Zoltan captain pays you for your assistance.

event.name: BLACKMARKET_ENGI_ILLEGAL_KILL
event.text: You're fearful of the punishment awaiting you from the Zoltan ship for killing the Engi, but you quickly scrap what you can from the wreck.
"I do believe we told you NOT to kill the Engi, yes? There is no reward awaiting you for this display of unnecessary brutality."

event.name: BLACKMARKET_ENGI_ILLEGAL_DEFEND
event.text: You regret the unnecessary bloodshed, but you don't pass up the opportunity to scrap the remains of the Zoltan ship.
"Aid in combat unexpected. We are now in debt. Accept this gift."

event.name: BLACKMARKET_MANTIS_ROCK_OFFEND
event.text: The black market is rather peaceful for a pirate controlled sector, but the Rock and Mantis ship here are in the starts of a conflict. You try to listen to their conversations but it's too risky. Besides, you probably wouldn't be able to decipher their screeching anyways.

choice.text: Ask what the conflict is about.

event.text: Both ships hail you simultaneously, fighting over each other to give you their side of the story.
"Damn bugs are selling the organs of our ancient ancestors! These belong to Rock-kind, not dim-brained flesh rippers." The Mantis ship butts in, and they start arguing again.
"Fine! Death is your fate then. We tear you open first!"
"Pah! You think we will cower in fear at a lowly Federation ship? The Federation's days are numbered, and so are yours."
The two ships are too busy arguing with each other to notice you sneaking away.

"Idiot pebble brained do-nothing brutes! They think we sell organs of ancient ancestor. No. We sell pretty Rocks we find in asteroid. We tear them open, show who boss!" The Rock ship interrupts, and they start arguing again.
"Fine! Death is your fate then. We tear you open first!"
"Pah! You think we will cower in fear at a lowly Federation ship? The Federation's days are numbered, and so are yours."
The two ships are too busy arguing with each other to notice you sneaking away.
No need to get involved in alien conflicts. You fly a safe distance away.

event.name: BLACKMARKET_MANTIS_ROCK_OFFEND_WIN_ROCK
event.text: With the Mantis ship dead, you quickly scrap the remains.
"You surprise me, Federation ship. Rare is it that you defend another ship's honor. We have little to offer you besides spare ammunition."

event.name: BLACKMARKET_MANTIS_ROCK_OFFEND_WIN_MANTIS
event.text: With the Rock ship dead, you quickly scrap the remains.
"We not need help. But... you did save us. Fine, we pay you in... thanks."

event.name: DISTRESS_PIRATE_VAMPWEED
event.text: The origin of the distress call is a small Vampweed shuttle being chased by a slaver. They don't have many means to defend themselves.
The slaver switches targets the moment you draw near. "Another juicy target! So be it!"

choice.text: Wait for the slaver to catch their quarry.

event.text: You graciously wait for the slaver to conduct their business. Once they do, the slaver hails you. "You're a patient one. I take it you want to do business with us, then?"
"A great purchase. May they serve you well, captain..."
"A great purchase. May they serve you well, captain..."
"A great purchase. May they serve you well, captain..."
"Okay then. If you say so...?" Weirded out, the Slaver leaves.
You don't bother getting mixed up in this situation. Your uninvolvement will ensure that nobody will think better or worse of you.

event.name: DISTRESS_PIRATE_ARGEONN_TIIIKAKA
event.text: An Argeonn ship is putting out a distress call. A Tiiikaka ship is following it, likely intending to take slaves.
The Tiiikaka ship seems content with you as their new target!

choice.text: Fight the Argeonn smuggler before the slaver arrives.

event.text: The Argeonn ship has no choice to engage, but it looks like they don't plan to stay!

choice.text: Don't get involved with the pirates.

event.text: You let the pirates settle their own disputes.

event.name: QUEST_SLAVE_SHIP_DERELICT
event.text: A crashed slaver ship is adrift at this beacon. The ship barely has enough functionality to hail you. "The crew of this ship was eaten by a horrifying plant monster! Fortunately it wasn't able to find us slaves in the brig..."

"After it devoured everyone on the ship - except us, of course - it went back to its own ship... Maybe you can find it somewhere in this sector." The slaves send the logs of the derelict ship to you, which helps you determine the likely destination of their ship. You might be able to convince one of them to join you.
The Separatist slave agrees to work aboard your ship as the rest get off at the next population center.
The human slave agrees to work aboard your ship as the rest get off at the next population center.
The Rock agrees to work aboard your ship as the rest get off at the next population center.
You leave the slaves to their own devices - they're lucky enough to have their freedom.

event.name: PIRATE_VIGILANTE_SCRAP
event.text: After taking the survivors onto your ship, you scrap the ship. It's been mostly looted already, but you manage to find some resources in the wreck. You drop them off as soon as you reach a safe haven.

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: You've heard tales of a man-eating plant abomination that eats crew at this beacon.

event.name: VIGILANTE_CULTIVATOR_SLAVER
event.text: The moment you jump in, the vessel you've heard about turns to face you. You notice the weapons warming up as you approach. A large Cultivator sneers at you. "You may not wear the colors... but you've been partaking in the slave trade, haven't you? Don't answer. You're going to regret the association!"

event.name: VIGILANTE_CULTIVATOR_NORMAL
event.text: The moment you jump in, the vessel you've heard about turns to face you. "What do you want? I have no quarrel with you."

choice.text: Tell them about the slaves that survived his feast.

event.text: "So? I have no quarrel with them either. My hunger is only satisfied with slavers." The Cultivator's stomach (or nearest equivalent) grumbles. "Ugh, and it's never satisfied either."

"We used to have an arrangement with some Tiiikaka ships. We notice a patrol in a government region, we let the others know. They do the same. You know that phrase 'there's no honor among thieves'? Turns out, one of our regular correspondents found an opportunity for a promotion at our expense."

"Wasn't always this big, you know. When my old ship and crew were left for dead, we ran out of supplies. There comes a time you find out what you'll do to survive. But even after I was the only one left, I barely lived long enough before a Shell just so happened to find my ship. They're always looking for Vampweed volunteers, you know. They fixed me up, but I've been hungry ever since."
"I'm a monster am I? Then you'll forgive me if I sample your corpse when I've wrecked your ship!"
"Fine. Neither do we."

event.name: VIGILANTE_CULTIVATOR_GOOD
event.text: The moment you jump in, the vessel you've heard about turns to face you. As they hail you, the Cultivator breaks into a toothy grin. "Renegade, I've heard you've been killing some slavers lately. If you're interested in increasing that body-count even more, I've got something you might want to consider."
"I'm a monster am I? Then you'll forgive me if I sample your corpse when I've wrecked your ship!"
"Then get outta here. We'll handle it ourselves."

event.name: VIGILANTE_CULTIVATOR_HELP
event.text: "There's a slaver that's been rising in the ranks of Tiiikaka recently. Their base is hidden at this beacon. I've been planning an attack, but I don't think my ship can go at it alone. The base is guarded by three ships at all times. I might be able to take two, but three won't do, especially if they call for reinforcements."

choice.text: Agree to take on a slaver ship.

event.text: "Perfect. See you on the other side." You and the other ship approach the base. One of the defending vessels charge straight at you while the base provides fire support!
"Stop wasting my time."

event.name: SLAVER_BASE_ASSAULT_AFTERMATH
event.text: You help the Cultivator clean up the other ships. Their ship is on its last legs, but before it explodes, the crew manages to beam down to the slaver base. By the time you get down there to follow them, they're already ripping apart the occupants of the base. You meet the Cultivator stepping out of the boss' quarters, picking something out their teeth. "That felt good. Anyway, now that my ship is gone, I'm free to follow you. What do you say?"
The Cultivator joins your crew. The rest of their crew stay on the base and collect the wealth onboard, freeing the slaves as well.

choice.text: Leave the Cultivator on the station.

event.text: "Hmph, fine then. I'll wait until some unwary slaver comes here for a restock then." You finish scrapping the wrecks around the battlefield.

event.name: QUEST_SMUGGLER_RAID_START
event.text: You notice some traffic around a smuggler station orbiting a moon close by. You tune into their comms and hear an offer for a mercenary job.

A grizzly looking smuggler answers your hail. "Lookin' for a job? Well I got one for you, if you ain't a coward. A rather... expensive and pretty illegal shipment of mine was confiscated by those stuck up Zoltan assholes, saying all of their usual crap. Thing is, this is OUR sector, not theirs. I want that shipment back, and I don't care how so long as it's unharmed. You up for the challenge?"

"Well that's a surprise. Alright kid, I'll transfer over the co-ordinates. Find the depot and kill the guard. Go to the storage room and there'll be a vault. Ain't no way they opened it yet, only I got the passcode, and the vault's super blast resistant. I have no choice but to trust you, so here you go. The code is 7-E-Blue. Don't ask why. Get the cargo and there will be another list of coordinates to bring it back to. I'll be waiting for you there."
"Pffft, figured. Ain't like I want some idiot Fed hauling around my valuables anyways." He ends the call abruptly.
You aren't about to go selling yourself as mercenaries. You have standards.

event.name: QUEST_SMUGGLER_RAID

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: Location of a smuggler vault confiscated by Zoltans.

event.text: You've arrived at the co-ordinates given to you. You're still a bit of a distance away, and it's hard to make out how well the Zoltan guard is armed.
You arm the weapons and prepare to fight.

choice.text: Screw this, fly away before they notice you.

event.name: QUEST_SMUGGLER_RAID_VAULT
event.text: As you scrap the guard's hull, a drone pops out from its hull and deploys a distress beacon before self destructing. You quickly break the beacon but it's too late. Their reinforcements will be arriving soon, so you must hurry.
As anticipated, the vault remains unopened. It is protected by a passcode. The first part is a number.

The alarms buzz and an extra layer of security slams shut on the vault door. You quickly flee but the Zoltan reinforcements arrive just in time to fire a barrage of missiles straight through your defences before you can escape.

The alarms buzz and an extra layer of security slams shut on the vault door. You quickly flee but the Zoltan reinforcements arrive just in time to fire a barrage of missiles straight through your defences before you can escape.

The alarms buzz and an extra layer of security slams shut on the vault door. You quickly flee but the Zoltan reinforcements arrive just in time to fire a barrage of missiles straight through your defences before you can escape.

The alarms buzz and an extra layer of security slams shut on the vault door. You quickly flee but the Zoltan reinforcements arrive just in time to fire a barrage of missiles straight through your defences before you can escape.
You're right! Just two more to go. The next part looks to be a letter.

The alarms buzz and an extra layer of security slams shut on the vault door. You quickly flee but the Zoltan reinforcements arrive just in time to fire a barrage of missiles straight through your defences before you can escape.

The alarms buzz and an extra layer of security slams shut on the vault door. You quickly flee but the Zoltan reinforcements arrive just in time to fire a barrage of missiles straight through your defences before you can escape.

The alarms buzz and an extra layer of security slams shut on the vault door. You quickly flee but the Zoltan reinforcements arrive just in time to fire a barrage of missiles straight through your defences before you can escape.
Right again! One more to go. The next is a color.

The alarms buzz and an extra layer of security slams shut on the vault door. You quickly flee but the Zoltan reinforcements arrive just in time to fire a barrage of missiles straight through your defences before you can escape.

The alarms buzz and an extra layer of security slams shut on the vault door. You quickly flee but the Zoltan reinforcements arrive just in time to fire a barrage of missiles straight through your defences before you can escape.

The lights on the vault door light up green. You quickly open the door and grab the crate inside. Attached are some co-ordinates that you quickly program into your star map and fly away before the Zoltan can arrive.

The alarms buzz and an extra layer of security slams shut on the vault door. You quickly flee but the Zoltan reinforcements arrive just in time to fire a barrage of missiles straight through your defences before you can escape.

The alarms buzz and an extra layer of security slams shut on the vault door. You quickly flee but the Zoltan reinforcements arrive just in time to fire a barrage of missiles straight through your defences before you can escape.

The alarms buzz and an extra layer of security slams shut on the vault door. You quickly flee but the Zoltan reinforcements arrive just in time to fire a barrage of missiles straight through your defences before you can escape.

The alarms buzz and an extra layer of security slams shut on the vault door. You quickly flee but the Zoltan reinforcements arrive just in time to fire a barrage of missiles straight through your defences before you can escape.

The alarms buzz and an extra layer of security slams shut on the vault door. You quickly flee but the Zoltan reinforcements arrive just in time to fire a barrage of missiles straight through your defences before you can escape.

The alarms buzz and an extra layer of security slams shut on the vault door. You quickly flee but the Zoltan reinforcements arrive just in time to fire a barrage of missiles straight through your defences before you can escape.

The alarms buzz and an extra layer of security slams shut on the vault door. You quickly flee but the Zoltan reinforcements arrive just in time to fire a barrage of missiles straight through your defences before you can escape.

The alarms buzz and an extra layer of security slams shut on the vault door. You quickly flee but the Zoltan reinforcements arrive just in time to fire a barrage of missiles straight through your defences before you can escape.

choice.text: Blow a hole in the door.

event.text: You vaguely remember the smuggler saying something about the door being blast proof, but go ahead anyways. The explosion barely puts a dent in the door, and sets off the alarms. You try to escape but the Zoltan reinforcements arrive just in time to fire a barrage of missiles straight through your defences before you can escape.

event.name: QUEST_SMUGGLER_RAID_FINISH

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: Return the cargo to the smuggler for your reward.

event.text: The smuggler is already at this beacon waiting for you. "Well well well, I'm surprised you made it. Good job."
You're wary of giving him the package and he laughs. He hands over half the payment first, and you give over the cargo. He pays you the rest and you shake hands, then he jumps away.
"You don't WHAT?" He yells at you for a while, then ends the call. You're afraid he's going to attack, but instead he simply jumps away.

event.name: FLOATING_CARGO_MV
event.text: Not too far from the beacon, you detect a destroyed cargo ship with its cargo scattered nearby, intact.

choice.text: Leave it alone, this looks suspicious.

event.text: You leave the cargo alone and prepare to jump.

choice.text: (Upg. Sensors) Run an advanced scan on the boxes.
(Long-Ranged Scanners) Run an advanced scan on the boxes.
(Slug Crew) Have your Slug check the boxes.
(Telepathic Shell) Have your Shell check the boxes.

event.text: They appear to be filled with military supplies! You take everything you can use and jettison the rest.
The cargo was primarily consumer goods and clothing, nothing particularly useful. You manage to collect some scrap.

Once you bring the cargo onto your ship, a pirate bursts out of one of the crates saying, "Ugh... I was getting cramped in there. Oh, yeah! Prepare to die!" Immediately after this battle-cry your ship is filled with the sound of crates breaking open...
You bring the cargo aboard. Before you have a chance to open them a pirate ship appears out of hiding and charges. At the same time, the crates fly open. Intruders aboard the ship!
The cargo appears to contain nothing of much interest. You salvage some scrap from the destroyed ship.
You are able to breach the protective barrier and scan the cargo. It appears to be filled with military supplies! You take everything you can use.
You pick up faint life signatures inside the cargo. The life forms appear to be armed. This looks like a planned pirate ambush.

choice.text: Destroy the crates to prevent another ship from falling victim.

event.text: You fire on the crates, breaking them open and scattering the pirates into empty space. A pirate ship appears out of nowhere with a message, "You will pay for that!"

choice.text: Leave it alone and prepare to jump.

event.text: It would be stupid to try anything.

event.name: BLACKMARKET_SMUGGLER
event.text: Out of nowhere, a smuggler jumps in, guns blazing. You don't know why they're attacking, but you have no choice but to engage.

event.name: BLACKMARKET_REBEL
event.text: You hardly have time to react before a Rebel ship observing the ongoings spots you and rushes in to attack.

event.name: BLACKMARKET_FED_ANGERY
event.text: A large squadron of Federation ships is present at this beacon, firing on the pirates, while a swarm of smaller ships are arresting some of the shoppers. You're accidentally swept up into the chaos when they mistake you for a pirate and engage.

event.name: BLACKMARKET_FED_AUTO
event.text: A Federation Auto-ship is dutifully patrolling this beacon, or at least it would have been if its sensors hadn't been torn out of its head by pirates. It scans your ship but is unable to properly identify you due to the damage, and thinks you're a pirate!

event.name: ZOLTAN_LECTURE_MARKET
event.text: A Zoltan peace brigade is lecturing some pirates on the importance of good morals. You stop in to watch in amusement when one of the pirates gets impatient and attacks. You're too close to get away, so you have to decide which side you're going to have to take.
You ready yourself for combat.
You ready yourself for combat.

event.name: ZOLTAN_LECTURE_MARKET_WIN_PIRATE
event.text: You successfully dispatch the Zoltan ship. You notice the Zoltan forces are retreating, and it appears the pirates won. You scrap the Zoltan ship quickly.

"Say, that was some good fightin' kid. Thanks for the help. I'm sure I have something to repay you." You're surprised at the pirates' gratitude and are suspicious of a trick, but the cargo crate they deliver you is surprisingly harmless and contains a shiny new military class weapon.

event.name: ZOLTAN_LECTURE_MARKET_WIN_ZOLTAN
event.text: You successfully dispatch the pirate ship. You notice the pirates are retreating, and it appears the Zoltans won. You scrap your victim quickly.
"We were not expecting Federation reinforcements. Your help is much appreciated. As is Zoltan custom, we are now in your debt and shall pay it off dutifully."

event.name: SMUGGLER_ASTEROID
event.text: The asteroid field here isn't the only hazard at this beacon. The smuggler here trying to hide doesn't give you a chance and immediately attacks!

event.name: BRIGADE_PULSAR
event.text: You aren't alone at this pulsar it appears, for another Zoltan peace brigade ship appears to be stuck. However, they seem to identify you as a threat and attack!

event.name: SMUGGLER_UNLOCK_1
event.text: You beam your crew aboard. You won't have long until reinforcements arrive, but you notice a map with coordinates. It appears to lead to a shipyard of some sort. You mark it down your map and haul out of here.

event.name: SMUGGLER_UNLOCK_2
event.text: You're surprised to see the scale of the shipyard, a massive space station commandeered by the Smugglers. Though it's hard to tell, you believe it may have once belonged to a major corporation, likely Hephaestus.

You're shocked at how few ships guard the station, and you're able to simply enter without any protest. You notice several ship designs you don't recognize, including the same model as the guard from earlier, an early prototype of a Rebel Gunboat. One of them appears to be operational and is protecting a large, cruiser-sized vessel made from the parts of other ships.

choice.text: Attack the ship to get to the cruiser.

event.text: Still, even now, as you move in to attack one of their own ships, no other ships approach even just to spectate. Regardless, it appears that this will be no easy fight.
This place is dangerous, we have no reason to go messing around with the Smuggler clan.
This place is dangerous, we have no reason to go poking around in the Smuggler clan's central shipyards.

event.name: SMUGGLER_UNLOCK_3
event.text: The gunboat collapses, scattering debris around the interior of the shipyards. You scoop up the material.

As you approach the cruiser, a much larger Smuggler vessel uncloaks nearby, and hails you. A tall, slender Slug appears on the vidscreen. "I ssssee you have come for our new prototype cruissser, eh?" The Slug chuckles. "In cassse you aren't aware, that cruissser right there was being built ssspecifically for the boss, Ocym. But, sssseeing how well you dessstroyed that vesssel of oursss I'd say the ssship isss better in your hands. Heheheh..."

choice.text: Accept his offer and take the ship.

event.text: As you get to work on reprogramming the ship to jump back to the Federation hangar, you notice a loud clicking noise from inside. Before you can react, an explosion consumes the entire ship and kills one of your crew! You receive one last hail from the Slug. "You sssshould know Captain, never trusssst a pirate. Now get out of my sssshipyard."

removeCrew.text: Fortunately your crew is able to be revived by the Clone Bay, but the same can't be said for the ship destroyed by the bomb.

choice.text: The AI advises against boarding that ship, as it is very likely rigged with a last-ditch trap. Not like you have any crew to send to it anyway.
Offer a compromise for the blueprints - you can never be too sure with pirates.

event.text: You don't trust the Slug enough to just take the ship, so instead you offer a simple compromise. You request they hand over a copy for the blueprints of the ship, and you won't touch the physical version. Instead of accepting, the Slug breaks into laughter.

"Well you sssee, thisss wass ssupposssed to be a trap. That sssship isss rigged to explode when anyone triesss to take it. But... you ssseemed to have outsssmarted me. Ssssso, I'll make you a deal. I won't give you the sssship, no. But the blueprintsss, mossst certainly! It ticklesss me to think of the Federation usssing Sssmuggler tech... and I can ssshow you a way to hijack enemy frequenciessss too!"

event.name: QUEST_TUCO_START
event.text: A pirate station advertising itself as an inn is nearby. They're peaceful and the group inside appears to be made up of all kinds, including Rebels, Pirates, Federation Officers, and various assortments of aliens.
The bartender, a bulky Rockman who you're pretty sure is a wanted criminal, welcomes you in and offers a drink. Behind you the lively crowd is laughing and chattering away.

You grab your drink, pleasantly surprised to find it filled with a sweet nectar like substance. While drinking, you catch wind of a conversation between a group of pirates discussing someone named Tuco, an infamous pirate who stole a massive sum of money from a Mantis Hive Caravan and spent it all on funding his massive gambling addiction. You also catch the coordinates of his favourite casino.
You have no business with the station.

textList.name: TUCO_DRINK
textList.text: The Rockman slides you a shot of some suspicious looking alien goop. It's surprisingly tasty. Two drunken pirates get into a brawl behind you and are escorted out.

The bartender polishes a glass and hands you another shot. This time it's a relatively normal looking glass of liquid, but it makes your insides burn like fire. You cough and spit it out. You catch some Rebels behind you laughing.
You're handed a glass of a putrid smelling substance, which you're told is freshly bottled Slug slime. When the bartender isn't looking, you pour it down the sink.

The Rock gives you a glass of clear liquid. It doesn't taste like anything. The chattering in the background quiets down for a second when a drunken Slug falls off the stage, then goes back to its usual volume.
The drink tastes an awful lot like urine, and your suspicions are confirmed when the Rockman informs you it's Human waste, considered a delicacy in some areas.
While you down the latest shot, you watch a Mantis juggle flaming skulls. The crowd breaks into applause until the Mantis catches on fire and runs screaming out of the inn.

As you drink the green substance in your bottle you observe the crowd further. It's an interesting bunch. You can see enemies staring at each other across the room, and glancing away when their gaze meets.
You choke down the horrid substance given to you by the bartender, a strange chunky white substance. The Rockman tells you it's expired milk from a space whale.

event.name: QUEST_TUCO_CASINO
event.text: The casino in question is no pirate cesspit or ramshackle gambling city. In the distance drifts a giant yacht, with hundreds of ships swarming towards it. It floats above the surface of a humid jungle planet, and in the center is a giant structure hosting what is likely the population of an entire city.
It's not hard to find the casinos, with a blaring neon sign drawing in people like bugs to a beacon. Inside are rows and rows of slot machines, poker tables, and a few bars.
You aren't going to waste the opportunity while you have it. You feed some scrap into the nearest slot machine, which miraculously seems to accept it as viable currency, and wait.

choice.text: This isn't what we expected. Leave.

event.text: Whatever you had hoped to do here is pointless now.
Three golden 7s flash on the screen, followed by loud fanfare and confetti. The machine exclaims in a loud voice, "CONGRATULATIONS! You lost!"
Three golden 7s flash on the screen, followed by loud fanfare and confetti. The machine exclaims in a loud voice, "CONGRATULATIONS! You lost!"
Three golden 7s flash on the screen, followed by loud fanfare and confetti. The machine exclaims in a loud voice, "CONGRATULATIONS! You lost!"
Three golden 7s flash on the screen, followed by loud fanfare and confetti. The machine exclaims in a loud voice, "CONGRATULATIONS! You lost!"
A low buzz emits from the machine and a drawer opens up, spitting out more scrap. It's rather anticlimactic, but you aren't complaining.

event.name: TUCO_SEARCH
event.text: Before you can even begin searching, a shout echoes throughout the casino. People turn to stare as a Rockman in pirate paint with a filthy moss beard and eyepatch with an elegant tuxedo is dragged out by two burly Rockmen bouncers. On his way out, the pirate exclaims "You can't do this to me! Do you know who I am? I am the dread pirate Tuco, the most feared man in the entire galaxy!" The Rockmen ignore him and continue to carry him outside.

You aren't sure what you plan to do, but the situation has you curious. You follow them outside to see Tuco heading back to a large cruiser with yellow pirate paint. Not long after, the ship powers up, its weapons come online, and he's firing at the casino! A few enforcer ships fly out to meet him, but it's uncertain who will win the fight.
You power up your weapons and attack one of the enforcers head on. It looks suspiciously like a Rebel transport that was painted over again, but that doesn't matter.
You're sure the casino will have a reward for you if you save them from Tuco's attack.
Whatever you had hoped to do here is pointless now. You leave before the fight can catch up to you.
Whatever you had hoped to do here is pointless now.

event.name: TUCO_WIN
event.text: The casino enforcer plummets towards the ground. The rest of the ships, seeing Tuco is now no longer the only threat, retreat. The yacht owners offer a handsome sum of money, and free drinks, to both you and Tuco if you promise not to cause further damage.

Tuco chuckles as he brings the scrap back to his ship. "Good fightin' there kid. Couldn't have done it better myself. SO, I'll tell you what; this hunk o' junk that I'm disgraced to call my personal cruiser has seen much better days. So how 'bout I hitch a ride on that pretty ship o' yours, and you do whatever you'd like with mine."

event.name: CASINO_WIN
event.text: The remains of Tuco's cruiser crashes into the ground, shattering into debris that probably kills a few people. Regardless, it's scrap for you to take.

Despite all the damage caused in the fight, the yacht owners are extremely grateful for your help. "That idiot has been a regular for years, and he's always causing issues. It's about time he got what was coming to him. Pffft, dread pirate my ass. As generous payment, please accept this scrap and a few of our slot machines!" You aren't sure what you think about the unusual reward, but you aren't going to turn it down.
